title: Ghost Moon
author: Butlin, Ron
snippet: before sweeping left down into Leith Street, past  Fairley's Ballroom  where the squaddies and sailors still battled out the war  with each other, not that she'd ever be going there again. Then  past the Playhouse cinema where the organist on his platform  rose up through the floor to play during the interval, past treelined  Elm Row and into Leith Walk proper.

title: Trainspotting
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: Is there ever a good one, though? Ah quicken ma pace — which isnae easy wi this heavy holdall — and get oantae Leith Street. What the fuck's it aw aboot?
